item.title: Is Getting Certified Worth It? Do the Benefits Outweigh the Costs?
item.description: If the job you seek requires a license, then making a decision is easy â€“ you don’t really have a choice. Licensure and certification are both means of verifying your skills and expertise, but they have some distinct differences. In a nutshell, a license is issued by a government authority and is legally required to practice in a field or hold a certain title. Certification is voluntary, serving as a reassurance to your peers and clients that you meet specific qualifications.
